documentation.

## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install python_interviews in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure python_interviews package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to python_interviews
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/j5ynth/python-interviews):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/j5ynth/python-interviews.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/j5ynth/python-interviews)

``` sh
$ conda install -c j5ynth python_interviews
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/python-interviews/)

``` sh
$ pip install python_interviews
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/j5ynth/python-interviews)’s
[pages](https://j5ynth.github.io/python-interviews/). Additionally you
can find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/j5ynth/python-interviews) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/python-interviews/) respectively.
